page.title: 01Lincoln Edge Farmland
page.content: This area covers part of the ridge known as the Lincoln Edge or Cliffe, which runs south from Lincoln, and the farmland to the west of it. This is intensively farmed arable and grassland. The main crops being Wheat, Barley, Oilseed Rape, Peas, Potatoes and sugar beet with both beef cattle and sheep being raised on the grassland. The villages in the area are small with few amenities and now that farming is mechanised and fewer people are needed to work the land many people have to find jobs in nearby towns. The children are also 'Bussed ' to schools (primary and secondary) in other areas. This means that the villages have become dormitories and the motor car is essentially for transport to shops, doctors surgery etc. where there is no local bus service
